original:
Traditional mill sites operated by large forest industry companies, particularly in Finland, are increasingly being transformed into biorefineries. These biorefineries utilize forest biomass to produce a diverse range of products, including textiles, chemicals, cosmetics, fuels, medicines, intelligent packaging, coatings, adhesives, plastics, as well as food and animal feed.
